sentences.en: A sense of imminent doom was inescapable.
sentences.cn: 一种即将来临的毁灭感无可逃避。

sentences.en: A sense of impending doom (= coming very soon ) gripped her.
sentences.cn: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

sentences.en: A sense of impending doom came upon all of us.
sentences.cn: 我们所有人都有一种大难临头的感觉。

sentences.en: Attendance figures had been steadily dropping, creating a mood of doom and discouragement among theatre directors.
sentences.cn: 上座人数一直持续下降，使得戏剧导演产生悲观泄气的情绪。

sentences.en: Doom means a judicial sentence or judgment.
sentences.cn: 判令指司法判决和裁定.

sentences.en: For Faulkner, the key - word is doom.
sentences.cn: 就福克纳而言, 关键字眼是“劫数”.

sentences.en: From the moment Edward had told her of the escape attempt, she had been overtaken by a sense of impending doom.
sentences.cn: 自从爱德华告诉她打算逃跑的那一刻起，她便强烈感到厄运在一步步逼近。

sentences.en: His doom was to be spoken.
sentences.cn: 他的判决即将给宣布出来.

sentences.en: It isn't the crack of doom.
sentences.cn: 还不是世界末日.

sentences.en: Owen thought he could see Cowperwood's approaching doom quite plainly.
sentences.cn: 奥文认为他能够很明白地看出柯帕乌迫在眉睫的灾祸.

sentences.en: She had then offered him the chance to baffle his doom.
sentences.cn: 当时她向他提供战胜厄运的机会.

sentences.en: The doom has no power on me longer.
sentences.cn: 那个对我的诅咒已经失败了.

sentences.en: The doom which I have passed upon her is irrevocable.
sentences.cn: 我对她下的判决是不能挽回的.

sentences.en: the national feeling of doom and gloom.
sentences.cn: 全国的悲观失望气氛。

sentences.en: The plan was doomed from the start .
sentences.cn: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

sentences.en: The plan was doomed from the start.
sentences.cn: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

sentences.en: The report on our economic situation is full of doom and gloom.
sentences.cn: 这份关于我们经济状况的报告充满了令人绝望和沮丧的调子.

sentences.en: They're just like eggs hurled against stone; they're heading for their doom.
sentences.cn: 鸡蛋怎能碰得过石头, 还不是自寻死路.

sentences.en: Thousands of soldiers met their doom (= died ) on this very field.
sentences.cn: 数千名士兵就是在这个战场上丧生的。

sentences.en: Why are people so full of gloom and doom?
sentences.cn: 为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？

words.tran_cn: 世界末日；最后的审判日
厄运；死亡；判决；世界末日

trans.tran_cn: 厄运，劫数，毁灭，悲观，沮丧
trans.tran_en: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc
